intro: Glischrocaryon flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered glischrocaryon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
